description.narrative: Support the UAE's full transition into green economy realizing its vision of UAE Vision 2021 and Green Economy for Sustainable Development Vision. Assist the UAE government in the implementation of the Green Agenda 2030, a national cross-sector green growth framework, to achieve its desired objectives of improved environmental performance, climate resilience, economic diversification and enhanced monitoring capabilities.

The UAE faces a complex set of challenges in pursuit of Green Growth. First, it is a hydrocarbon-based economy that must accelerate the speed of economic diversification to mitigate risks from highly volatile oil & gas prices.Second, the country lies in a hyper-arid climate, is highly water-scarce and consumes large amounts of energy for cooling and desalination. Third, it has a rapidly growing population and high dependence on expatriate laborforces. Fourth, its governance structure is highly decentralized (a federal system) and there is an increasing gap in development between Abu Dhabi /Dubai and other emirates.To address such challenges, the UAE developed its UAE Vision 2021 and Green Economy for Sustainable Development Vision to ensure long-term sustainable development. To achieve the goals outlined in thesenational plans it has been identified that the lack of a cohesive national framework that incorporates all sectors and emirates needs to be addressed.

mailing-address.narrative: Global Green Growth Institute, 19F Jeongdong Bldg., 21-15 Jeongdong-gil, Jung-gu Seoul 04562 Republic of Korea

title.narrative: "UAE Green Growth Initiative" - Project Results Report
Knowledge sharing and capacity building activities are effective in improving participat knowledge/skills in green growth

description.narrative: 70.00% of workshop and training participants gain improved knowledge and/or skills relating to green growth.

title.narrative: 70% of workshop and training participants gain improved knowledge and/or skills relating to green growth
Middle East and (North) Africa Ministerial Dialogue and regional knowledge sharing activities

description.narrative: ? Regional gathering: green growth index workshop A regional workshop on GGGI’s green growth index was held in September 2018 with the participation of officials from UAE and Jordan. It improved the understanding of green growth performance measurement for most of the participants. ? Country-specific session: Egypt GGGI’s UAE office contributed to the green growth introductory workshop in Egypt to introduce green growth concepts and methodologies to the Egyptian government, raise awareness about regional green growth activities already under way and support the process of membership and country program development in Egypt.

title.narrative:
At least one regional gathering per year, with relevant topic corresponding to GGGI working themes
At least two country specific sessions organized (Jordan, Morocco)
80% of attendees rate the forum as useful
The UAE government adopts and deploys implementation actions in the Climate Resilient Green Growth Master Plan for 2017-2018.

description.narrative: GGGI assisted the UAE Ministry of Climate Change and Environment in developing the National Climate Change Plan 2017-2050. The UAECabinet adopted the Plan in June 2017 as an overarching framework response to climate challenges. The key milestone in 2018 was the commencement of the National Climate Change Adaptation Program, an implementation initiative of the Climate Plan.

title.narrative: Ministerial endorsement, Council approval on the Master Plan and its work program (budget)

Implementation Support Mechanism for the government ("G-support"*) made operational; implementation support packages on the priority, catalytic actions** in the Master Plan delivered through "G-support"

description.narrative: GGGI’s UAE office supported the implementation of the green agenda 2015-2030 with the core projects such as the Air Emissions Monitoring Project, Green Jobs Program, The National Climate Change Adaptation Program.

title.narrative: 85% of G-support packages delivered with requester's satisfaction; 70% of G-support package achieved relevant stakeholder and government endorsement

description.narrative: Public officials: 4 climate adaptation capacity building workshops were held, one for each of health, energy, infrastructure and environment. In addition, 2 workshops on developing national-level air emissions inventory were organized. Youth: 1 workshop on sustainable food and agriculture, in cooperation with FAO and the embassies of Australia and the Netherlands, where university student teams presented their ideas for sustainable food businesses. Private sector: 3 private sector training workshops were conducted for data collection and awareness raising for companies whose activities fell within the purview of the air emissions monitoring project.

title.narrative:
Two "fit-for purpose" training program streams designed, tailoring for stakeholder needs (one for government officials, the other for the youth)
At least 80% trainees assess their knowledge and ability improved.
At least 70% trainees respond training methodologies applied to be effective
Online interface and outreach activities delivered (G-Support online, GGMN, WFES)

description.narrative: The Green Growth MENA network platform was put on hold due to budgetary restrictions during 2018 and was not completed.

title.narrative: Platform for GGMN and G-Support online is developed and launched

The UAE achieving on-track progress in all relevant national KPIs and international commitment (e.g. INDC) through action implementation from the Climate Resilient Green Growth Master Plan*
*updated NGGS building on the progress achieved since 2014 and reflecting the government reform in 2016
